title: Spike: Consider delaying attestation production if block validation is happening
body:
https://discord.com/channels/697535391594446898/697539289042649190/1032740792126681108

i have a proposal for teku that would improve validator performance especially when paired with the sister project besu which sometimes suffers from slow block import times
but even with other EL nodes i think this small change is even beneficial for reaching consensus

in the scenario where CL (teku) already has the block, it has confirmed that it is valid from a CL point of view but EL (besu) is still busy validating but the attestation deadline passes - teku should WAIT for engine_newPayloadV1 to return instead of rushing out the attestation

* It's ok to be optimistic about EL validity if CL is valid, proposer only has one attempt at this without getting slashed and would harm exclusively himself if EL payload is not valid
* If we're optimistic about EL validity then the rushed attestation will most certainly be for the wrong block_root and result in lowered rewards (possibly even a penalty if the previous block had low votes and leads to us also getting the source wrong)
* There are 4 full seconds to get the attestation to the aggregator - in my experience that's more than enough and it's totally fine to eat into that a little
* Even if this leads to missing the aggregation deadline a late (1 block) but correct block_root vote yields higher rewards than a timely but wrong vote
* The consensus model plans for votes coming in late and handles it gracefully - I think this and the reward structure shows that it favors correct votes over timely (rushed) votes

please consider, thanks

I #6595 should be implemented first, so when we can decide to apply the delay only for block that will meet the late block threshold, otherwise we risk to vote on a block that have high change to be reorged out but the next proposer.

Well there is not such a strict dependency but it has to be taken into account. Block arrival time should be considered (a threshold) in the logic that decides if apply or not the delay.
